text: Chromolaena impetiolaris is a rare Caribbean species of flowering shrub in the sunflower family. It is found only the Island of Dominica in the Lesser Antilles.Grisebach, August Heinrich Rudolf 1861. Flora of the British West Indian Islands 357-358Nicolson, Dan Henry 1987. Phytologia 62: 164Plants of the Eastern Caribbean, Chromolaena impetiolaris (Griseb.) Nicolson Jstor Global Plants, Chromolaena impetiolaris (Griseb.) Nicolson includes photo of herbarium specimen Chromolaena impetiolaris is a shrub lacking hairs on its herbage. It has opposite leaves with no petioles but with numerous small glands on the blades. Flower heads are displayed in a flat-topped array. ==References== impetiolaris Category:Eupatorieae Category:Flora of Dominica Category:Plants described in 1861
title: Chromolaena impetiolaris
